name: Quran reader in Arabic

alignment.comment: Direct access to the Qur'an for reading, clear public benefit.

openness.comment: No LICENSE file or explicit licensing, add MIT or similar to enable legal reuse.

liveness.comment: No commits since 2018, no issues or PR activity, no releases.

value.comment: Lightweight Arabic reader, technically modest but useful as a static site.

docs.comment: Lacks README, local setup, and accessibility notes.

community.comment: No CONTRIBUTING or CODE_OF_CONDUCT, minimal contributor base, no templates.

summary: A simple static Qur'an reader in Arabic hosted on GitHub Pages. Without a license, documentation, and recent maintenance, it remains a useful demo but not a reusable open-source project.
narrative: This project provides a fast, minimal Arabic Qur'an reading experience as a static site. It demonstrates a straightforward build that can serve users without a backend.
However, the repository has seen no development activity since 2018 and lacks documentation and licensing, which limits community reuse and contributions.
Adding a permissive license, basic docs, and minimal governance would lift it into the Aligned range and make it easier for others to adopt or extend.
recommendations: Add a LICENSE file (MIT or BSD-3-Clause).
Create a README with local setup, build, and deploy steps.
Add CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, and simple issue or PR templates.
Publish a small accessibility checklist and tag a release with a short CHANGELOG.
If the project is complete and intentionally inactive, note archival status and link to active readers.
